title: Ilya Sutskever
content:
{{Short description|Canadian computer scientist (born 1985/86)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2023}} {{Use Canadian English|date=February 2023}} {{Infobox scientist | name = Ilya Sutskever | honorific_suffix = {{post-nominals|country=CAN|FRS|size=100%}} | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth based on age as of date |29|2015}}{{cite web |last1=Simonite |first1=Tom |title=Ilya Sutskever |url=https://www.technologyreview.com/innovator/ilya-sutskever/ |website=technologyreview.com|access-date=14 August 2022 |date=18 August 2015}} | birth_place = [[Nizhny Novgorod|Gorky]], Russian SFSR, Soviet Union{{Cite web |title=Heard It Through the AI {{!}} University of Toronto Magazine |url=https://magazine.utoronto.ca/people/alumni-donors/heard-it-through-the-ai-openai-ilya-sutskever/ |access-date=9 October 2022 |website=University of Toronto Magazine |language=en-US}}{{cite web |title=Season 1 Ep. 22 Ilya Sutskever |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fCoavgGZ64Y |via=YouTube |publisher=The Robot Brains Podcast |access-date=14 August 2022 |date=21 September 2021}} | death_date = | death_place = | citizenship = Canadian | fields = [[Machine learning]]
[[Artificial neural network|Neural networks]]
[[Artificial intelligence]]
[[Deep learning]]{{Google scholar id}} | workplaces = [[University of Toronto]]
[[Stanford University]]
[[Google Brain]]
[[OpenAI]] | alma_mater = {{Plainlist| * [[Open University of Israel]] * [[University of Toronto]] (BSc, MSc, PhD) }} | doctoral_advisor = [[Geoffrey Hinton]]{{MathGenealogy}} | academic_advisors = | doctoral_students = | notable_students = | known_for = [[AlexNet]]
Co-founding [[OpenAI]] | thesis_title = Training Recurrent Neural Networks | thesis_url = https://hdl.handle.net/1807/36012 | thesis_year = 2013 | influences = | influenced = | awards = | religion = | signature = | website = {{Official URL}} }} '''Ilya Sutskever''' {{Post-nominals|country=GBR|FRS}} ({{lang-he|איליה סוצקבר}}; born 1985/86) is a [[Russians|Russian]] Israeli-Canadian [[computer scientist]] working in [[machine learning]], who co-founded and serves as Chief Scientist of [[OpenAI]].{{cite news |last1=Metz |first1=Cade |title=A.I. Researchers Are Making More Than $1 Million, Even at a Nonprofit |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/19/technology/artificial-intelligence-salaries-openai.html?action=click&module=RelatedCoverage&pgtype=Article®ion=Footer |access-date=22 October 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=19 April 2018 |language=en}} He has made several major contributions to the field of [[deep learning]]. He is the co-inventor, with [[Alex Krizhevsky]] and [[Geoffrey Hinton]], of [[AlexNet]], a [[convolutional neural network]].{{cite q|Q59445836}} Sutskever is also one of the many co-authors of the [[AlphaGo]] paper.{{cite q|Q28005460}} ==Early life and education== Sutskever was born in [[Nizhny Novgorod]], [[Russia]], at the time part of the [[Soviet Union]], and at age 5 immigrated with his family to [[Israel]].{{Cite news |last=מן |first=יובל |date=2022-11-18 |title="הבינה המלאכותית מהמדע הבדיוני תהפוך למציאות" |language=he |work=Ynet |url=https://www.ynet.co.il/digital/technology/article/h1ebvhxuj |access-date=2023-04-18}} He spent his formative years in [[Jerusalem]].{{Cite web |last=Ansari |first=Tasmia |date=2023-03-07 |title=The Brain That Supercharged ChatGPT, ImageNet and TF |url=https://analyticsindiamag.com/the-brain-that-supercharged-chatgpt-imagenet-tensorflow/ |access-date=2023-03-14 |website=Analytics India Magazine |language=en-US}} Sutskever attended the [[Open University of Israel]] between 2000 and 2002{{cite web |title=Neural networking |url=https://thevarsity.ca/2010/10/25/neural-networking/ |website=The Varsity |access-date=14 August 2022 |date=25 October 2010}} before moving with his family to Canada and transferred to the [[University of Toronto]], where he then obtained his [[Bachelor of Science|BSc]] (2005) in mathematics{{cite web |last1=Johnston |first1=Jessica Leigh |title=A Neural Network for a New Millennium |date=8 December 2010 |url=https://magazine.utoronto.ca/people/students/ilya-sutskever-google-phd-fellowship/ |website=University of Toronto Magazine |access-date=14 August 2022}}{{Linkedin}}and his [[Master of Science|MSc]]{{cite thesis |last1=Sutskever |first1=Ilya |title=Nonlinear multilayered sequence models |year=2007 |hdl=1807/119676 |url=https://tspace.library.utoronto.ca/handle/1807/119676|website=utoronto.ca|publisher=University of Toronto|oclc=234120052|degree=MSc |language=en}} and [[PhD]]{{cite thesis |last1=Sutskever |first1=Ilya |title=Training Recurrent Neural Networks |year=2013 |hdl=1807/36012 |url=https://tspace.library.utoronto.ca/handle/1807/36012|website=utoronto.ca|publisher=University of Toronto|id={{ProQuest|1501655550}}|oclc=889910425|degree=PhD |language=en}}{{cite web |title=RAM Workshop |url=http://www.thespermwhale.com/jaseweston/ram/ |website=thespermwhale.com |access-date=14 August 2022}}{{cite web |title=Episode 85: A Conversation with Ilya Sutskever |url=https://voicesinai.com/episode/episode-85-a-conversation-with-ilya-sutskever/ |website=Voices in AI |publisher=Gigaom |access-date=14 August 2022}} in [[computer science]] under the supervision of [[Geoffrey Hinton]]. ==Career and research== [[File:Democratizing Deep Learning with Nervana and Google Brain (15105407149).jpg|thumb|Sutskever (second from right) at the Stanford Graduate School of Business in 2014]] After graduation in 2012, Sutskever spent two months as a [[postdoc]] with [[Andrew Ng]] at [[Stanford University]]. He then returned to University of Toronto and joined Hinton's new research company DNNResearch, a [[University spin-off|spinoff]] of Hinton's research group. Four months later, in March 2013, Google acquired DNNResearch and hired Sutskever as a research scientist at [[Google Brain]].{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/2013/03/google_hinton/|title=Google Hires Brains that Helped Supercharge Machine Learning|last=McMillan|first=Robert|date=13 March 2013|website=wired.com|access-date=9 November 2019}} At Google Brain, Sutskever worked with [[Oriol Vinyals]] and [[Quoc Viet Le]] to create the [[seq2seq|sequence-to-sequence]] learning algorithm. He is also a co-inventor of [[AlexNet]] and has worked on [[TensorFlow]].{{cite q|Q29040034}} At the end of 2015, he left Google to become the director of newly founded [[OpenAI]]. {{cite web|title=OpenAI Blog|date=12 December 2015|url=https://www.openai.com/blog/introducing-openai/|access-date=17 July 2016|archive-date=6 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211006105333/https://openai.com/blog/introducing-openai/|url-status=dead}}{{Official URL}}{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/2016/04/openai-elon-musk-sam-altman-plan-to-set-artificial-intelligence-free/|title=Inside OpenAI, Elon Musk's Wild Plan to Set Artificial Intelligence Free|last=Metz|first=Cade|date=27 April 2016|website=wire.com|access-date=9 November 2019}} ===Awards and honours=== * 2015, Sutskever was named in [[MIT Technology Review]]'s 35 Innovators Under 35.{{cite web|title=35 Innovators Under 35: Ilya Sutskever|url=https://www.technologyreview.com/lists/innovators-under-35/2015/visionary/ilya-sutskever/|website=technologyreview.com}} * 2018, Sutskever was the keynote speaker at [[Nvidia]] Ntech 2018 and AI Frontiers Conference 2018.{{cite web |last1=Martin |first1=Scott |title=Reinforcement Learning ‘Really Works’ for AI Against Pro Gamers, OpenAI Trailblazer Says |url=https://blogs.nvidia.com/blog/2018/09/14/reinforcement-learning-openai-pro-gamers-ilya-sutskeverai-elon-musk-gpu-dgx/ |website=Nvidia Blog |publisher=Nvidia |access-date=28 March 2023}} * 2022, he was elected a [[Fellow of the Royal Society]] (FRS).{{Cite web |title=Ilya Sutskever |url=https://royalsociety.org/people/ilya-sutskever-35834/ |access-date=12 May 2022 |website=royalsociety.org|publisher=[[Royal Society]]|location=London|author=Anon|year=2022}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sutskever, Ilya}} researchers]] [[Category:Canadian expatriates in the United States]] [[Category:People from Nizhny Novgorod]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society]] {{Canada-scientist-stub}}
